wikipedia_page.main:
John Cocks (1787–1861) was a British phycologist.
He was the first to discover the red algae Stenogramme interrupta, on 21 Oct 1846.The standard author abbreviation Cocks is used to indicate this person as the author when citing a botanical name.

response: *John Cocks, 1st Earl Somers (1760–1841), British peer and politician
